column5: Dang can't you all keep your weather under control. We are getting a blast from the North that is dropping us down to the single digits and we are talking Fareinheit. I expect  I will be workin my butt off this week with frozen pipes if you all don't stop this weather soon. So to pay you back..... the week of lak air The Southern Contingency will be bringin some really HOT weather with us.  Art
Hi there Art...Bring it on..I can take it......Hey why wait for spring? Come on up this weekend
BOO HOO!!!   Bring it on!!  LOL  bly
If I  knew you could bring the hot weather this way I'd come down now and get ya myself tonight. Supposed to hit -30 c up here tonight.  Mike
That doesn't sound like much of a threat Art, more like a promise. Can we hold you to that???
Art, you don't happen to know which temperature Bubba wears a shirt at do ya? Dat's de temp I want.
Dat would be anything less than 60F Roy,   :lol:
windchills of -47 here tonight!!
Ooooooh, I'm shaking in my boots!!  Is that a promise or a threat Art.  We can take anything you throw at us up here bud.  Bring it on.  Now go find your toque dear.  Joey
Hey don't blame us, we import all of our cold weather from Alaska and then warm it up a little and resell it back to you guys!  jjcanoe

Hey Art, want this weather???  Thunder Bay: Issued 4.00 PM EST Sunday 4 February 2007 Wind chill warning in effect.  Tonight Clear. Wind becoming northwest 20 km/h early this evening. Low minus 31. Wind chill minus 43. Monday Sunny. Wind northwest 30 km/h. High minus 19. Wind chill minus 44. Monday night Clear. Wind northwest 30 km/h becoming light in the evening. Low minus 28. Wind chill minus 39. Tuesday Sunny. High minus 9. Wednesday Sunny. Low minus 21. High minus 11. Thursday Sunny. Low minus 21. High minus 11.  Note: -40C and -40F, are basically the same temperature, cold, lol.

Sometime more than that! 60*F will freeze yer nadz off if you're used to a 100+*F heat index!... Oh how I wish I could bring some nice 'Bama August weather up to Lakair with me, the best description I've heard was "like trying to breathe with your head in a bucket of mud"... and I triple dog dare any Canadians to come down during the month of August and just follow me around at work and on the lake, you would die! Just like I would if outside up there like I do down here.     BTW... I am getting pretty tired of these lows in the low to mid 20's every night and highs only in the mid 40's-50's. Y'all knock it off and gimme my nice warm blanky back!!!

Been there done that.  Eufaula AL, August Don't know what the temp was, AC in the truck was not working couldn't sleep more than about 15 mins straight that night, the next day at my pick-up they had a power outage over the weekend and the electric forklift didn't charge fully and died with a a half loaded semi- trailer.  The solution, was to hand bomb about 22,000lbs of veneer onto my trailer.  At least we were out of the sun.  Hotter than hell!  jjcanoe

Anytime Glen, anytime...I love the heat...sure beats these minus 20's to minus 30's here to go with the foot of snow I've had in the last 24hrs.  And Art, do your worste buddy, do your worste...just think how much business we're drumming up for you with the cold blast  , you should be thanking us and bringing us gifts in june  Maureen
I'm thinking autographed toilet plungers....in firetiger.
Even Canadians think that is just a bit silly. Minus 47!!!!!!! I might even have to wear gloves tomorrow, dang it.

I prefer this to the stuff that GCD  and jjcanoe were talking about.  I can put on stuff to stay warm, but that oppressive heat and humidity is just miserable, no escape.  In lovely suburban Etobicoke right now, it's a brisk -15C /  -5F tonight.  Goretex, fleece, toques, gloves, mittens, balaclavas, fur and even the zipper were invented right here in the Great White North.  Get out there and get some fresh air, for Heaven's sake.  Breathing with your head in a bucket of mud---that's funny right there.
Balaclava... that's that greasy layered pastry from the Middle East... right?

Yea I guess threatening y'all with heat when its sub zero ain't much of a threat is it.....kind of like bringin a knife to a gun fight. Hows about I make it warm enough for Glen to fish nekkid? Of all the plumbin jobs frozen pipes are the worst. You already know that you will get wet and the area you are workin is below freezing so were is the joy it's just hard money. The good side is people are really grateful when they have water again.  Art

We all like to blame it on the weatherman/woman. Not their fault, it's really a plot of us Northerners to overthrow the American government!  If we get our way then we can all go south to hibernate till spring so we can go winter fishing in our T-shirts.  Stay warm eh!
LOL PikeHunter, we want your water, but don`t want to have to bring chainsaws to cut it!

LOL!  Thanks everyone for the morning laugh!  This thread exhibits why this site if the BEST fishing forum sites on the net!  Good thing I don't drink coffee, it may have been spilt while reading this thread.  Oh wait, that would have to be iced coffee with this weather!  HF
